attributes.description: Crop areas (status represents about year 2005), crop calendar data and crop mega environments (consistent with climate at about turn of century) in support of Agricultural Climate Indicator calculations
attributes.history:
Thu May  3 16:52:54 2018: ncks -O -v sow_a1 /nobackup/users/neutvd/data/autowms/adaguc-test-data/FAULTY_soybean_2vars_characterictics_05d.nc /nobackup/users/neutvd/data/autowms/adaguc-test-data/FAULTY_soybean_2vars_characterictics_05d_sow_a1.nc
Wed May  2 10:34:28 2018: ncatted -O -a units,time,d,, FAULTY_soybean_2vars_characterictics_05d.nc
Fri Apr 20 07:42:43 2018: ncatted -O -a units,time,o,c,days since 2005-06-30 00:00:00 soybean_2vars_characterictics_05d.nc
Aggregation to 0.5degrees, compilation and netcdf reformatting, (19-Apr-2018): R.W.A. Hutjes, Wageningen University]
attributes.source crop area data: You, L., U. Wood-Sichra, S. Fritz, Z. Guo, L. See, and J. Koo (2017). Spatial Production Allocation Model (SPAM) 2005 v3.2., Retrieved from http://mapspam.info
attributes.source crop calendar data: Sacks, W.J., D. Deryng, J.A. Foley and N. Ramankutty (2010). Crop planting dates: an analysis of global patterns, Global Ecology and Biogeography 19, 607-620. DOI: 10.1111/j.1466-8238.2010.00551.x.
attributes.source crop mega environments: Fischer, R. A., Byerlee, D. and Edmeades, G. O. (2014). Crop yields and global food security: will yield increase continue to feed the world?, Canberra: Australian Centre for International Agricultural Research, Retrieved from http://aciar.gov.au/publication/mn158
